p: Mazza in 1983 [ 35] make the first GC-MS investigation on the volatile components of myrtle berries from Sardinian myrtle berries. He gave a detailed picture of the volatile components of myrtle berries analyzing the methanol extract of berries from Sardinia after centrifugation with water and extraction with pentane-methylene chloride that was used for GC-MS analyses. An alcoholic extract (60% ethanol) and commercial samples of liqueurs were also analyzed.
